siddharth_dixit2000 wrote:
> Hello everyone,
> 
> Iam trying to use Junit to test my business logic, which involves
> retrieving data from the legacy systems. This business logic is running
> inside the container of Websphere application server.
> 
> While I was trying to test this business logic, Junit is not allowing
> me to do so. So how do I test my business logic using JUnit.
> 
> I know Cactus would solve my purpose, but I do not want to use Cactus
> as I want to go in for unit testing rather than end-to-end testing.
> 
> Can anyone help me in deciding the strategy I should be using?

Yes. The book _JUnit Recipes_ discusses several strategies, but the 
basic idea is this: run your business logic outside the container.

Can you extract your business logic so that it takes container resources 
as parameters? This way, your tests can provide implementations of those 
resources that don't necessarily come from the container.

If you'd like to discuss a more specific case, we can probably give you 
more specific advice.
